title: Domain 1.2: Summarize fundamental security concepts.
content:
🔒 CIA Triad: Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability

  • Confidentiality: Keep data private using encryption, access control, and least privilege.
  • Integrity: Ensure data remains unaltered using hashes, digital signatures, and checksums.
  • Availability: Ensure systems stay online via backups, failover, and redundancy.

🧾 Non-repudiation

Provides proof of actions using digital signatures, logs, and certs — confirms “you did it.”

👤 AAA: Authentication, Authorization, Accounting

  • Authentication: Verifies identity (e.g., password, biometrics).
  • Authorization: Controls access to resources (e.g., ACLs, roles).
  • Accounting: Tracks user actions (e.g., logs, audits).

🔍 Gap Analysis

Compares current vs. desired security posture to find missing or weak controls.

🧱 Zero Trust Model

“Never trust, always verify” — eliminate implicit trust zones.

  • Control Plane: Policy logic and decisions.
  • Adaptive Identity: Adjusts access based on context.
  • Threat Scope Reduction: Shrinks trust boundaries.
  • Policy-Driven Access Control: Applies fine-grained rules.
  • Policy Administrator: Defines policies.
  • Policy Engine: Evaluates access requests.
  • Policy Enforcement Point (PEP): Executes allow/block decisions.
  • Data Plane: Actual data communication path.
  • Subject/System: Entity making the request.

🧱 Physical Security

  • Bollards: Block vehicle access.
  • Access Control Vestibule: Mantrap to verify identity.
  • Fencing: Physical boundary.
  • Video Surveillance: Deterrent and evidence.
  • Security Guard: Real-time human monitoring.
  • Access Badge: Controls entry (swipe/proximity/smart cards).
  • Lighting: Deters intruders and aids visibility.

🔍 Sensor Types

  • Infrared: Detects heat/motion.
  • Pressure: Detects footsteps or weight shifts.
  • Microwave: Detects movement via wave disturbance.
  • Ultrasonic: Detects motion using high-frequency sound waves.

🎯 Deception and Disruption Technology

  • Honeypot: Fake system to attract and analyze attackers.
  • Honeynet: Network of honeypots for a deeper decoy setup.
  • Honeyfile: Decoy document to detect unauthorized access.
  • Honeytoken: Fake credentials or data that trigger alerts if used.
